event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair procedure to replace the affected FRU.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: A component failed in an External I/O Expansion Unit FRU
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
This message indicates a diagnosis of a failure in a microcontroller, power FET, or transmitter contained within a FRU. The recommended service action is to schedule a replacement of this FRU.

Controllers may give intermittent time-outs as part of normal operations and allow a system to continue functioning. If these intermittent time-outs become too frequent, a threshold check is done and a fault message is called out. Hard failures will cause a loss of the FRU and to devices which reside behind it.

Follow the steps below to determine which Field Replaceable Unit (FRU) has been affected and to collect data for presentation to your authorized service provider.

Step 1: Collect the fault message.
A single line fault message is displayed to the system console and logged in the /var/logs/message file. The complete message may be retrieved by using the 'fmdump' command on the XSCF console as shown below.

Example:

LEGEND:
RED = SUNW-MSG-ID
BLUE = EVENT_ID
GREEN = FRU

 XSCF> fmdump -m
   MSG-ID: IOXSCF-8000-1A, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 27 05:21:35 PDT 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: BE80601000, HOSTNAME: server-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: 2073e3f0-9ce2-4dd4-879f-ee2810274b89
   DESC: A component failed in an External I/O Expansion Unit FRU
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/IOXSCF-8000-1A for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: No immediate action is taken
   IMPACT: Hardware affected by the device failure may become unusable.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair procedure to replace the affected FRU.
Step 2: Collect the "fmdump" output.
Use the fmdump command with the Event-ID option to retrieve more information on the fault which has occurred.

Example:

 XSCF> fmdump -v -u 2073e3f0-9ce2-4dd4-879f-ee2810274b89
   TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
   Mar 27 05:21:35.2329 2073e3f0-9ce2-4dd4-879f-ee2810274b89 IOXSCF-8000-1A
     100% fault.chassis.iox.device.fail
          Problem in: hc:///iox=983392/fanctrl=0
             Affects: -
                 FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassisid=BE80601000:server-id=server-
   0:serial=XCX031:part=5016937:revision=03/component=IOX@X031
Step 3: Provide the output collected to your service provider.
The information collected above will help your service provider to schedule a repair at your convenience.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: Hardware affected by the device failure may become unusable.
event_registry_properties.name: response
title
event_registry_properties.item: External I/O Expansion Unit device failure
